name: Shae Thomas
text: I started using this gas station within the last 2 years. In the past I never really cared for the location tho now I'm not sure why. I rarely go elsewhere.  Their icee's are fire,  they carry Tastycake powdered donuts, nice selection of wine- I'm kinda assuming this.  I know nothing about wine but they have a bunch of different ones so I figured the possibility was high. The employees are super nice. One lady (who loves Alabama football) did me an absolute solid. "I" accidently left my 4yo's cup in the store while she was working. I had no idea.  Searched everywhere (I thought) for 2 days.  We have other cups, too many actually but he prefers the one abandoned. Can't blame him,  I have my own cup that no others can live up to. I get it. We went back to the store on day 2. While checking out she says "oh yeah" or something of the sort. She walks away, comes back with cup while telling me I'd left it. Glad she cleared that up cause home invasion had popped in my mind. It is a Cars cup after all. I apologize to Trussville PD explaining false alarm and hang up. That's a joke, they have me blocked. Anyway, I thank her a bunch, tell her how happy I am to have it, 4yo says "thank you" cause he should. I'll allow note taking just this once. We leave, I hear something fall off car. I stop and back up only to hear a crunch. It's pretty loud. Reluctantly I step out of the vehicle and start laughing hoping to lighten the blow. I ran over my chips. Didn't see that coming did you. Deuces.

text: I'll never, ever, rate a single star to this gas station; not even a half of a star, bc it doesn't  deserve any at all, seriously...the only reason I had to select 1 is bc I'm forced to in order to post a review! Lol , not surprised.  It pisses me off, though, how these employees... @ the Shell/Circle k store#:21569 in Theodore...& I'm talking about  the ones @ this store ONLY, especially the older brown lady that worked on the night of thursday Nov 1st 2018 , is the worst of them all, bc many times, in line, I've witnessed her, and other employees, show their ridiculously rude attitude, being completely unprofessional..& they all have their jobs still!!??? I mean the position requires top notch customer service...actually, I'm lying,  it doesn't even require "good customer service", bc customer service doesn't take much effort at all!! If you are even the slightest bit capable to understand how to smile, respond to a question with that smile, and be available to do YOUR job, like YOU were hired to do when YOU APPLIED (no one asked you to apply for the position...especially when you are not capable to atleast do those extremely simple things/requirements), then, anyone, who is anyone, can work in customer service if they allow themselves to be genuine. Anyone will easily  outshine  the current employees. As well as, a difference in profits will most likely  be seen, bc these current employees obviously are  not fit one bit due to their lack of simple professionalism.  As long as ive lived here, in Theodore, I've only come across 2 girls that are not part of the problem. 1 of the 2 girls still wrk there,  and she was working on the 1st as well but she was off by 8pm. The gas station could be a 5 star, but the ppl chosen to be the face of your location, are far from great choices.. unfortunately !! if it's employees weren't so extremely rude, lazy, and unprofessional & theyd look at you like you're literally stupid because you asked a question they don't feel like responding to, like you're interrupting their damn day!. Anyway,  it's almost like it's always been the gas station that's known for hiring the same type of wrong ppl, that carry themselves very unprofessional bc they just don't care!!

name: Brandon Pouncy
text:
Very low-key gas station in the middle of nowhere. This was the last road trips. We want to take on the way back from New Orleans to Tennessee but when you need gas you need gas.

Definitely your typical gas station with low Lighting in very shady at night. This is one of those gas stations you would prefer if you were the only one there when getting out of the car. The cashier at the time was very uneducated on the surroundings and could not help us with anything.

As far as interior gifts items to buy excetera this gas station had more than enough and we did not have problem buying snacks water and using the restroom. Definitely go in and out if possible and hopefully come out safe. Godspeed gents.

On the plus side if you happen to get hungry there is a Little Caesars attached on the left side. I don't know if they have corresponding hours but during normal hours "Pizza Pizza"

P.S. bring a spare flashlight

name: Gary Jones
text: I scheduled appointment to quote 7 separate electrical improvements in my house. They contacted me the day of appointment to ask to reschedule. We rescheduled for two weeks out. After calling in late to work to be present for an 8:00 appointment, I waited until 9:30. No show. I called the home office number. They explained that there was a circumstance that made them late; didn't know when they would arrive. I cancelled the appointment and will use another company that showed up the first time, on time. I gave two stars because Mr. Electric was recommended. Can't be all bad. But, really need to work on communication.

resp.text: Gary, we do value your time and regret that this was your experience. Customer service is always a top priority at Mr. Electric, and while we have fallen short in this instance, we do appreciate your feedback and will make adjustments on our end so that we are able to better serve our customers going forward. Thank you.

name: Rosie Smoots
text: I’m SO pleased with their service!!! I wanted to install a ceiling fan on my covered porch. I contacted my regular electrician and after waiting a week and a half, I was told it can’t be done. I then contacted a second electrician and was told it can be done but the wires won’t be hidden and it will be “very unsightly”.  I decided to try Mr. Electric because the quote was free and timely. David Hurley came out within an hour of me calling and gave me a fair estimate. Less than 48 hours later I’m now enjoying my new ceiling fan (with no exposed wires) on my covered porch!!!! The job was quick, he explained my warranties AND he cleaned up after himself which I was not expecting! I’d recommend Mr. Electric for any of your electrical needs. 5-stars

resp.text: That is great to hear, Rosie! We appreciate your comments and are glad to hear you are enjoying your porch even more with your new fan. Thank you for your business, and let us know if there is anything else we can do for you!

name: TheJeffrey575
text:
After scheduling a job I was notified the day before the scheduled electrical work to remind me the electrician was coming and the time within 30 minutes. The electrician showed up right on time ready to estimate the job. After we agreed on the costs the electrician was ready to get started right then! We were used to a contractor estimating a job and notifying us, sometimes a few days later, when they could start work. Not the case with Mr. Electric! The electrician was ready to start.

As the job progressed we needed to make a few changes, so the electrician re-estimated the cost and we were ready to go. The electrician asked me about fire alarms and CO sensors. Our fire detectors were almost 35 years old so we added them to the job.

All the commercial stuff is good, but the electrician was outstanding! They were very responsive to our comments. I have worked thousands of contractors in my work life and now in my retirement. The skill and quality of the electrician's work was simply beautiful. I will definitely call Mr. Electric for my next work.

My only concern was the local franchise was sold to another company so the calls to and from Mr. Electric are not local so I had to be "expecting" a call to keep from looking at the strange numbers and not consider them as robocalls.

resp.text: Wow! With all of your experience, that is quite an endorsement. Thank you so much! Customer service is a top priority here at Mr. Electric and we are so glad to hear that we exceeded your expectations. We appreciate your business.

text: I had a dimmer switch go bad and was "buzzing" inside. The old switch had three wires vs. the new 4-wire switch and the old switch had the green ground wire connected to a "Red" wire. Not wanting to take a chance of burning down my house I took the advise of my friend and called Mr. Electric. They were at my house and had the new switch in within three hours. Although people might feel their price was high, you get dedicated/trained electricians, insured and bonded. I'm willing to pay for that.

name: Sleep Walker
text:
Mr. Electric provided 5 star, first-rate service for the replacement of my distribution box and installed (4) additional outlets around the exterior of my house. The workmanship of Steven Leavins was simply marvelous and very professional done. I selected Mr. Electric over Dixie Electric, McGehee Electric and R&H Electric for the following reasons:
•	The survey technician, Steven Leavins, was friendly and conducted a fairly thorough survey of the work to be done. This is important because it prevents rework and unnecessary delays in completing the work.
•	Their estimate was very detail, well structured, and nicely presented. Usually, how the presentation (in this case documentation) is delivered reflects the quality of workmanship you can expect.
•	Quick response/reply. Mr. Electric responded to my initial query within hours as was your estimate. The other companies took 1-2 days to provide an estimate. This is impressive given the nice job done on the estimate.

I was not disappointed in my choice. Steven Leavins was awesome! His work, attitude, and self-pride are worthy of acknowledgement. I'm not easy to please, but Mr. Electric and the team (namely Steven) delivered as promised and as I expected. Really, if you want some electric work done call Mr. Electric first. Oh, yeah, the company is very reasonable. I promise you will love the workmanship (and the people).
